snippet: The length of the sentence for José Dirceu, a powerful figure in the Workers Party and chief of staff to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva when he was president, was precedent-setting, legal scholars said.
abstract: Brazil's Supreme Court sentences Jose Dirceu de Oliveira e Silva, top ally and former chief of staff of former Pres Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, to nearly 11 years in prison for orchestrating vast vote-buying scheme; length of sentence is seen as precedent-setting in political culture in which impunity in corruption cases has typically prevailed.
lead_paragraph: The length of the sentence for José Dirceu, a powerful figure in the Workers Party and chief of staff to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva when he was president, was precedent-setting, legal scholars said.

headline.seo: Ex-Brazilian Presidential Aide Sentenced in Vote-Buying Plot
headline.main: A Former Brazilian Presidential Aide Gets 10 Years in Vote-Buying Scheme
headline.print_headline: A Former Brazilian Presidential Aide Gets 10 Years in Vote-Buying Scheme
